title: How to pitch an idea for a TV commercial for a specific product - Quora

response.answer_text: In general, you don’t. Except for rare exceptions (when a brand might hold a contest for consumers to submit ideas), commercials are developed by a brand’s advertising agency. They’re paying millions of dollars a year for this service. And similar to how movie studios don’t accept unsolicited ideas, neither do brands or agencies — if they had already been developing a similar idea, or do so totally unrelatedly in the future, you could sue them, so there’s a blanket ban on unsolicited material. If you have these kinds of ideas often, the best route would be to develop a relationship with an agency – as a freelancer, if nothing else. You’ll probably find there’s a lot more that goes into it than just one good idea, from understanding the business’ goals and audience targets, to where and how the ad is distributed. Or, if you’re really passionate about this one idea, make it yourself and put it on YouTube — you probably have most of what you need right in your smartphone. If you make enough of them, and they’re well received, that’s a great way to get hired on a freelance basis by a brand or agency.

You research the brand/product. Understand the target for the specific product, highlight the benefits and why people should opt for and make sure that your solutions solves real problems. #advertising #brandactivation #TVadvertising
